siteProductLine.name: Roadian HTX2
siteProductLine.overview:
Nexen's Roadian HTX2 is an all-weather, highway terrain tire that's designed for use on light trucks and SUVs and offers drivers outstanding traction and handling performance year-round along with an up to 70,000 mile limited manufacturer tread life warranty.

Features & Benefits
  • All-weather tread pattern
  • Raised white letter (RWL) or Black sidewall depending on the tire's size
  • 70,000 mile limited manufacturer tread life warranty for P-metric sizes, and a 50,000 mile limited manufacturer tread life warranty for LT sizes
  • Three Peak Mountain Snowflake certified for use in moderate to severe winter weather conditions
  • Wide grooves and open shoulders force water out of the tread to reduce the risk of hydroplaning on wet roads
siteProductLine.secondaryDescription: Finding a tire that performs in dry, wet, and winter weather conditions is a must for most drivers, as each condition creates different challenges for tires. Fortunately, all-weather tires are engineered to perform in these conditions, and the Nexen Roadian HTX2 does that and more for drivers of light trucks and SUVs. Three Peak Mountain Snowflake certified for use in moderate to severe winter weather conditions, the Roadian HTX2's four wide grooves and open shoulders force water, slush, and melting snow out of the tread to reduce the risk of hydroplaning on wet and slippery roads. Large, angled tread blocks and dense siping increase traction and grip, and the Roadian HTX2's optimized design fends off uneven wear for a longer tread life while also improving fuel efficiency so that drivers spend more time on the road and less time and money at the pumps.

siteProductSpecs.name: Category
siteProductSpecs.description: All Weather tires are similar to All Season tires as they're built to perform year-round. The main difference, though, is that All Weather tires typically provide strong performance and grip in icy and snowy conditions.

siteProductSpecs.name: Vehicle
siteProductSpecs.description: Designed for use on light trucks and SUVs such as the Ram 1500, Ford F-150, and Chevrolet Silverado. Light Truck tires are strong enough to support a truck's heavier weight and whatever else is being hauled or towed.

siteProductSpecs.name: Mileage Warranty
siteProductSpecs.description:
This product is covered by a 70,000 mile manufacturer’s treadlife warranty. Merchandise covered by a manufacturer’s warranty is sold with the warranty by the 
        manufacturer extended to the purchaser. We will be happy to assist in obtaining fulfillment of a manufacturer’s 
        warranty. Other than applicable manufacturers’ warranties, there are no warranties, express or implied, 
        including any warranty of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose. The only tires SimpleTire can 
        warranty are brand new defects (meaning that they have not been mounted or driven on). Any bead damaged will be 
        void of any warranty claim. Any other adjustments should be taken to the nearest authorized dealer for that 
        manufacturer. Sometimes the manufacturer also provides a treadlife warranty and mileage rating. Please be aware 
        that not all tires hold a mileage warranty from the manufacturer. Different tire models, even from the same 
        manufacturer, may or may not come with a treadlife warranty.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Index
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum carrying capacity for a tire determined by the manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Max Speed
siteProductSpecs.description: Maximum speed capability to safely carry a load for an extended period of time.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum load carrying strength at the specified inflation pressure, also known as ply rating.

siteProductSpecs.name: Sidewall
siteProductSpecs.description: The side of the tire between the tread and rim, with cosmetic branding as well as information about the tire including manufacturer, model, size, etc.

siteProductSpecs.name: UTQG
siteProductSpecs.description: Standards that measure treadwear, temperature resistance and traction, example: "640 A A".  The 640 is the treadwear test and it lasted 6.4 times longer than the comparison tire tested against.  The first "A" is the traction rating using straight-line wet traction on test surfaces (see information tables tab) and the second "A" is the temperature rating by testing operation at high speeds without heat-related failure (see information tables tab).

siteProductSpecs.name: Wet Traction
siteProductSpecs.description: Wet Traction is a piece of the UTQG for example if  UTQG is: 500 AA A, the wet traction piece is the second piece, the "AA".

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Depth
siteProductSpecs.description: Measured in 32nds of an inch, this metric shows how much tread life is left on a tire, with the tire's traction & stopping capabilities greatly diminished at 4/32nds and less. Tire manufacturers include "tire wear bars" at 2/32nds to indicate when your tire is worn out.

siteProductSpecs.name: Inflation Pressure
siteProductSpecs.description: The highest inflation pressure (measured in pounds of force per square inch, PSI) the tire is designed to contain, and should only be used when called for by the vehicle placard.

siteProductSpecs.name: Part Number
siteProductSpecs.description: An identifier of a particular tire line and size combination assigned by the tire manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Design
siteProductSpecs.description: Tread design (or tread pattern) can affect handling, traction & noise for different driving styles & road conditions.

siteProductSpecs.name: Section Width
siteProductSpecs.description: The measurement of width from a tires inner sidewall to the outer sidewall.

siteProductSpecs.name: Rim Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The range of widths the rim of the vehicle can be for this tire to be safely mounted on.

siteProductSpecs.name: Overall Diameter
siteProductSpecs.description: The diameter of a tire that is inflated without any load applied.

siteProductSpecs.name: Three-Peak Mountain Snowflake (3PMS)
siteProductSpecs.description: A three-peak mountain snowflake (3PMSF) symbol branded on a tire's sidewall indicates the tire meets required performance criteria in snow testing to be considered severe snow service-rated.

image.altText: A Crossover Vehicle Driving Through Mixed Weather Conditions in the Mountains

header.title: All Weather tires
header.body:
# All Weather tires
A newer tire type, All Weather tires are a cross between All Season and Winter tires. 

Like All Season tires, All Weather tires offer drivers strong traction and performance in wet and dry conditions, but better performance in winter weather thanks to the use of flexible rubber compounds that help the tire to better grip cold, icy, snowy, or slushy roads. Like Snow and Winter tires, All Weather tires are often Three Peak Mountain Snowflake (3PMS) certified thanks to their ability to perform in severe snow conditions. Some of most popular tire manufacturers make All Weather tires, including [Goodyear](https://simpletire.com/brands/goodyear-tires/categories/all-weather), [Michelin](https://simpletire.com/brands/michelin-tires/categories/all-weather), [Toyo](https://simpletire.com/brands/toyo-tires/categories/all-weather), [General](https://simpletire.com/brands/general-tires/categories/all-weather), [Firestone](https://simpletire.com/brands/firestone-tires/categories/all-weather) and more. 

If you're looking for a set all-weather tires online then you've come to the right place, as SimpleTire has hundreds of great all-weather tires that meet your driving needs and budget.

[All weather tire reviews](https://simpletire.com/categories/all-weather-tires/reviews)

siteProductVisualizationInsightList.title: Excellent Mileage Warranty
siteProductVisualizationInsightList.sliderInfoModalContent:
This tire has an excellent warranty, which means that it's expected to last 
                            for a very long time based on the tire type. Regular tire maintenance, such as rotation and 
                            alignment, and safe driving habits are key to ensuring this tire hits its stated mileage warranty.
